headline: Bridge Collapses Hours Biden Infrastructure Speech
summary: A snow-covered bridge in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania collapsed on Friday just hours before President Joe Biden was scheduled to visit the city to speak about theInfrastructure Investment and Jobs Act.At least 10 people sustained non-life threatening injuries in the bridge collapse. “We saw today, when a bridge is in disrepair, it literally can threaten lives,”Biden said, adding, “We’re gonna rebuild that bridge, along with thousands of other bridges in Pennsylvania and across the country.” The$1.2 trillion infrastructure bill, which the presidentsigned into lawin November, invests$40 billion over five yearsto repair bridges that are in “fair or poor” condition.Some coverage from the right focused on a specific Biden quote: “I knew there were a lot of bridges … And we’re gonna fix them all.” AFox News (Right)homepage headline said Biden made a “huge promise.” Some coverage from the left drew a direct connection between the collapse and Biden’s infrastructure bill; aGuardian (Lean Left)article opened with the line, “It would be hard to imagine a more dramatic way to illustratethe need for investment in U.S. infrastructure.”
